intro: Cracca fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Cracca fasciculata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
